org.albertschmitt.crypto

Class AESService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService

  • public class AESService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements AES 256-bit encryption using the Bouncy Castle API which gets around the 128-bit limitation imposed by the java runtime. Clients can use this class to easily incorporate encryption into their applications. Note when converting between strings and byte arrays clients should be sure to convert using the UTF-8 character set.

    External Dependencies: Bouncy Castle Release 1.52

    • bcpkix-jdk15on.jar
    • bcprov-jdk15on.jar
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Albert Schmitt [acschmit] [at] [gmail] [dot] [com]

    • Method Detail

      • getAESKeySize

        protected static int getAESKeySize()
        Returns the AES key size. This is a protected function so the programmer can changed the default key size to 128 bits by sub-classing this AESService and using #setAESKeySize(int key_size) in the constructor to change it.
        Returns:
        The key size.

      • setAESKeySize

        protected static void setAESKeySize(int key_size)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Inherit from this class and call this function in the constructor to set the key size if you want it to be 128 bits instead of the default.
        Parameters:
        key_size - The desired AES key size. Only 128 and 256 are valid values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the key size is not 128 or 256.

      • getHmac256Digest

        public java.lang.String getHmac256Digest(byte[] msgBytes)
        Generates a keyed-hash message authentication code (HMAC) for the given message bytes.
        Parameters:
        msgBytes - The data for which the HMAC 256 Digest will be generated.
        Returns:
        The HMAC 256 Digest value for the input data.

      • encode

        public byte[] encode(byte[] data)
        Encode the byte data to AES256 and return it in byte array.
        Parameters:
        data - Byte array to be encoded.
        Returns:
        AES256 encoded byte array of input data.
        See Also:
        decode(byte[] data)

      • decode

        public void decode(java.io.InputStream instream,
                   java.io.OutputStream outstream)
        Decode the AES256 encoded input stream and return it in an output stream.
        Parameters:
        instream - AES256 encoded input stream to be decoded.
        outstream - Decoded output stream of input stream.

      • generateKey

        public void generateKey()
        Generate an AES key. A key generated by this method would typically be encrypted using RSA and sent to the recipient along with data that was encrypted with the key. The recipient would then decrypt the key using RSA then use the key to decrypt the data.

        This method also creates an HMAC key for use by the getHmac256Digest(byte[] msgBytes) method.

        See Also:
        getAesKey(), getHmac256Digest(byte[] msgBytes)

      • generateKey

        public void generateKey(java.lang.String password,
                        byte[] salt)
        Generate an AES key using a given password and salt.
        Parameters:
        password - The password to be used to create the key.
        salt - The 64 byte long array to be used to create the key.
        See Also:
        generateSalt(), getAesKey()

      • generateSalt

        public byte[] generateSalt()
        Generate a salt value using SecureRandom() that can be used to generate an AES256 key. The salt is 64 bytes in length.
        Returns:
        Byte array containing the salt.

      • getAesKey

        public byte[] getAesKey()
        Get the AES key that was created by generateKey() or generateKey(String password, byte[] salt)
        Returns:
        Byte array containing the AES key.
        See Also:
        setAesKey(byte[] data)

      • setAesKey

        public void setAesKey(byte[] data)
        Sets the AES key that was retrieved by the getAesKey() method.
        Parameters:
        data - Byte array containing the AES key.
        See Also:
        getAesKey()
